result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam M. Sommerfeld was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with Huber privileges.  IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence.

miscConds.notes:
No contact with the victim without the victim's and Agent's consent. No contact with Brandon Trina. No contact with Martin Marques.  No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No selling to any pawn shops.
---------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
---------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
---------------------------

Pay court costs, including mandatory DNA surcharge in the amount of $200.00.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.

timeConds.notes: The Defendant is to complete one-hundred (100) hours of community service work during his period of probation with NO BUYOUT.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: Defendant Adam M. Sommerfeld in court with attorney jeramiah maynard.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have an agreement.

Final pre-trial on August 16, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Adam M. Sommerfeld in court with attorney jeramiah maynard.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion deadline 06-06-16. Bond remains.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Adam M. Sommerfeld in court with attorney Jeramiah Maynard.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.  Bond remains.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH C.C.R. dob 1/26/2000 OR P.R.   Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH MARTIN MARQUEZ OR BRANDON TRINA.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant Adam M. Sommerfeld appeared, Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
